intro: Dianthus juniperinus subsp. bauhinorum, commonly known as the rock campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant features compact, evergreen foliage and produces clusters of pink or white flowers in spring. Its botanical characteristics include narrow, needle-like leaves and a compact growth habit. It is often used in rock gardens and alpine settings due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
